intro: Actinostephanus enpingensis, commonly known as the Guangdong star-flowered plant, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its unique floral structure and limited distribution make it a subject of interest in botanical research. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
